#Summary1=(human1) This guide to Isfahan, a beautiful ancient city in Iran, details its architectural sites such as the Safavid era Naqsh-e Jahan Square and Chaharbagh Boulevard, four stunning mosques and three palaces, and the Armenian Quarter (Jolfa), as well as transport information on airport and taxi connections.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) Isfahan, a historic Iranian city and former capital of Persia known as “Half The World,” features stunning Islamic architecture including the UNESCO-listed Naqsh-e Jahan Square, beautiful mosques adorned with intricate tiles, ancient palaces, and a unique Armenian Quarter established in the 1600s.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) Isfahan, in central Iran and a former Persian capital, is famous for its stunning Islamic architecture, including Imam and Sheikh Lotfollah Mosques, Ali Qapu Palace, and the UNESCO-listed Naqsh-e Jahan Square; The city also has a vibrant Armenian Quarter and an international airport with regional flights.

#Summary4=(Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) This article provides information about Isfahan, a city in central Iran known for its stunning architecture, beautiful streets, and historic mosques, including the famous Imam Mosque and Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque, and its many palaces and gardens, such as the Ali Qapu Palace and the Chehel Sotoun Palace.

#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Isfahan, an ancient and culturally significant city in Iran with a rich history, boasts impressive architecture like the Naqsh-e Jahan Square and its iconic mosques, and serves as a major transportation hub connecting various regions of the country.
#Text=Isfahan
#Text=Isfahan ( Persian : اصفهان , also known as Esfahan ) is a city in central Iran , south of Tehran and is the capital of Isfahan Province .
#Text=The Persians call it " Nesf - e - Jahan " , meaning " Half The World " .
#Text=Due to its beautiful hand - painted tiling and magnificent public square , it is considered to be one of the most beautiful cities in the world .
#Text=An ancient town and capital of Persia from 1598 to 1722 , it was long noted for its fine carpets and silver filigree .
#Text=Today , textile and steel mills take their place .
#Text=Its architecture , tree - lined boulevards and relaxed pace make it one of the highlights of Iran .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The city is 430 km south of Tehran at the foothills of the Zagros mountain range .
#Text=The city enjoys a temperate climate and regular seasons .
#Text=Isfahan is located on the main north - south and east - west routes crossing Iran .

#Text=The city has an Armenian Quarter called Jolfa ( originally called New Julfa ) established by Shah Abbas I in the 1600s after he destroyed the prosperous Armenian town of Julfa in Armenia and forced all of the Armenians to move to Persia , mostly to Isfahan .
#Text=They were allocated land and rebuilt a prosperous community that was a key part of an Armenian trade network extending from Singapore and India to Venice and Amsterdam .
#Text=Today the quarter still has many Armenian Churches , an Armenian school , shops and Armenian residents .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By plane
#Text=Isfahan International Airport or Isfahan Shahid Beheshti ( IATA : IFN ) was a military air base before the revolution .
#Text=There are daily flights to Tehran and Mashhad in Iran .
#Text=There are also flights to Damascus , Dubai , Kuwait and Istanbul .
#Text=From the Airport you can take cab for c. IRR 200,000 to the city centre .
#Text=Since most people are going there anyway , you can always ask people to share taxi .
#Text=See
#Text=Squares and streets
#Text=Naqsh-e Jahan Square
#Text=1 Naqsh-e Jahan Square .
#Text=Also known as shah square or imam square - 1602 ( Meidan Emam ) .
#Text=The square contains two mosques , a palace , and the bazaar .
#Text=The square is the largest historical public square in the world after Tiananmen Square in Beijing and it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site .
#Text=The square is surrounded by buildings from the Safavid era .
#Text=This a very popular place for locals to picnic on Friday and holiday evenings .
#Text=2 Chaharbagh Boulevard .
#Text=1596 , dating from the Saffavid era , the avenue is the most historically famous in all of Persia .
#Text=Meydan Kohne .
#Text=Shahshahan Square .
#Text=Mosques
#Text=Shah Mosque
#Text=Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque , interior of the dome
#Text=The stunning mosques of Isfahan are among the most beautiful and interesting in the world .
#Text=3 Imam Mosque ( called Shah Mosque before the revolution ) , Naqsh-e Jahan Square , south side .
#Text=Built during the Safavid period , it is an excellent example of Islamic architecture of Iran , and regarded as one of the masterpieces of Persian Architecture .
#Text=It is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site .
#Text=Its splendour is mainly due to the beauty of its seven - colour mosaic tiles and calligraphic inscriptions .
#Text=4 Sheikh Lotf Allah Mosque , Naqsh-e Jahan Square , east side .
#Text=One of the architectural masterpieces of Safavid Iranian architecture , this mosque is considered to be the most beautiful in Iran .
#Text=Built in 1602 by Shah Abbas I.= and designed by his chief architect , Sheikh Bahai .
#Text=The mosque was designed to be a private mosque for the royal family and therefore it does not have any minarets .
#Text=There is a tunnel from the mosque to the Royal Palace , across the square .
#Text=5 Masjed-e Jāmé of Isfahan , north of Naqsh-e Jahan Square in the old quarter .
#Text=Started in AD 842 , this is the first Islamic building to adopt the four - courtyard layout of Sassanid palaces .
#Text=6 Hakim Mosque , Hakim ( north of Naqsh-e Jahan in the old quarter ) .
#Text=One of the oldest mosques in Isfahan .
#Text=Built by Shah Abbas II between 1656 and 1662 .
#Text=Located on the site of a 10th century mosque .
#Text=The portal was covered in mud until it was discovered in 1956 .
#Text=Palaces
#Text=Ali Qapu Palace
#Text=Chehel Sotoun
#Text=7 Ālī Qāpū ( The Royal Palace ) .
#Text=Early 17th Century .
#Text=It is forty - eight meters high and there are seven floors , each accessible by a difficult spiral staircase .
#Text=In the sixth floor music room , deep circular niches are found in the walls , having not only aesthetic value , but also acoustic .
#Text=It is rich in naturalistic wall paintings by Reza Abbassi , the court painter of Shah Abbas I , and his pupils .
#Text=There are floral , animal and bird motifs .
#Text=8 Hasht Behesht ( The Palace of Eight Paradises ) .
#Text=1669 , reportedly built for residence purposes of the king 's harem .
#Text=Set within lush gardens which are free to roam if you do n't want to go inside the building .
#Text=9 Chehel Sotoun ( The Palace of Forty Columns ) .
#Text=1647 : It is called Palace of forty columns , as there are many columns , and in Iranian , 40 means many .
#Text=Incidentally , there are twenty columns , and these are reflected in the pool in front , which might also account for its name .
#Text=The function of this palace was for holding religious - national ceremonies and royal festivals and for receiving royal ambassadors and guests .
#Text=It's Persian Gardens is one of nine inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List .
#Text=Contains some spectacular battle murals .
